contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=March 2010}} {{Infobox Game| subject_name=Don't Break the Ice | image_link= | image_caption= | players=2 or more | ages=3 and up | setup_time=< 5 minutes | playing_time=3 to 8 minutes | complexity=Simple | strategy=Low | random_chance=None | skills=[[dexterity|Manual dexterity]] | footnotes= }} '''''Don't Break the Ice''''' is a children's tabletop [[game]] for two to four players ages 3 and up. Originally marketed by [[Schaper Toys]] in 1968, the game is presently manufactured by [[Hasbro]] subsidiary [[Milton Bradley Company|Milton Bradley]]. [[Image:Don't Break the Ice.jpg|thumb|A Game of Don't Break the Ice]] The game is played with a set of plastic 'ice blocks', a stand, and included miniature mallets. The stand is turned upside down and the ice blocks placed into the frame, so that the "shared" uniform compression of the blocks pressed against each other will cause them to stay in place when the stand is turned upright. The players take turns removing blocks by tapping with the mallets. The game ends when one player 'breaks the ice', causing all remaining blocks to fall. The player who removed the most blocks without 'breaking the ice' is the winner. == See also == * [[Thin Ice (game)]] == External links == * Hasbro's [http://www.hasbro.com/shop/details.cfm?product_id=8632 Don't Break the Ice product page] * {{bgg|4888}} {{Schaper Games}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Don't Break The Ice}} [[Category:1968 introductions]] [[Category:Board games of physical skill]] [[Category:Children's board games]] [[Category:Milton Bradley games]] [[Category:Schaper games]] [[Category:Tabletop games]] [[Category:1960s toys]] {{Game-stub}}
